intro: Ageratina paucibracteata, commonly known as white feather, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fluffy, white or pale blue flower heads. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescences consist of numerous tiny florets arranged in a spherical or ovoid shape. Ageratina paucibracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
